___markup-languages.description: Representation of the equation in various markup languages.

additionalProperties.description: List of representations for a particular markup language, such as LaTeX.

___markup.description: The markup text for the equation.

___dependencies.description: Dependencies for the markup to work, such as LaTeX packages.

___invocation.description: How include the dependency, e.g. a '\usepackage{}' statement.

___url.description: URL providing info about dependency, usually HTTP.

___verbose.description: The full text of the description. Don't add hard linebreaks; let the output formatter decide how to do that. Required field.

___terse.description: Description text that is 80 characters or less.

___uuid.description: Universally Unique Identifier for this equation.

___license-name.description: Usually a free software license, such as GPL, BSD, or MIT.

___year.description: Year the JSON was first written.

___authors.description: List of the people who wrote the JSON, not the equation itself.

___license-url.description: Link to the text of the license, usually HTTP.

___related-equations.description: UUIDs of other equations that are related to this one.

___uuid.description: Universally unique identifier of related command.

___relevant-urls.description: List of URLs that discuss the equation and its properties.

___date-known-good.description: Date when the link to the page worked. Useful if the page changes or link is broken and searching for an archival copy.

___unicode-pretty-print.description: Human-readable representation of the equations with Unicode text.

___terms.description: Descriptions and properties of the constants, variables, functions, and other components of the equation. Must be an array to preserve order.

___example-values.description: Examples of values the term may take on.

___units.description: Units as used in the original reference.

___doi.description: Digital object identifier for values from a published journal article.

___classification.description: Mathematical classification and properties of the quantity represented by this symbol.

___always-scalar.description: True if the symbol represents a scalar in this expression, i.e. not a vector, tensor, or other multi-value quantity.

___always-positive.description: True if the symbol represents a quantity that is always positive.

___always-an-integer.description: True if the symbol represents a quantity must be an integer or subset thereof such as a natural number.

___special-function.description: True if the symbol represents a known function with a fixed definition.

___always-dimensionless.description: True if the symbol represents a quantity is always dimensionless, such as radians or degrees.

___bound-variable.description: True if the symbol represents a bound variable, such as an index in an infinite series or a variable of integration in a definite integral.

___linear-operator.description: True if the symbol represents a linear operator for two vector spaces.

___fixed-constant.description: True if the symbol represents a fixed numeric value, such as π, √2, or the speed of light.

___urls.description: List of URLs directly about the quantity.

___label.description: Short description of the quantity, suitable for an 'where x is the ...' type statement.

___multiline.description: An array of strings that show the equation two-dimensionally. Uses an array instead of a multiline string for portability reasons.
